componentInstanceProperties.name: IntroText
componentInstanceProperties.value: VentureCrowd gives you access to handpicked opportunities on the same terms as professional lead investors.

componentInstanceProperties.name: tabContent
componentInstanceProperties.value: Crowdfunding has become a popular way to raise money for causes, projects, and business ideas. In fact, tens of billions of dollars are raised through crowdfunding around the world each year. Essentially, crowdfunding is about raising money from a large number of people. For aspiring entrepreneurs, crowdfunding offers a way to reach large numbers of prospective investors, rather than taking on a traditional business loan. In addition, crowdfunding can also be used for personal projects and social causes. When focusing on the business-related types of crowdfunding, including equity crowdfunding, you might be wondering ‘what types are there?’. What does crowdfunding involve, and how can creators and businesses implement a successful, effective campaign? This guide takes you through everything you need to know about this relatively new form of raising money.

componentInstanceProperties.name: tabNames
componentInstanceProperties.value: What is crowfunding,What are crowdfunding platforms,How crowdfunding works,Crowdfunding for Investors

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Crowdfunding has become a popular way to raise money for causes, projects, and business ideas. In face, tens of billions of dollars are raised through crowdfunding around the world each year.

Essentially, crowdfunding is about raising money from a large number of people. For aspiring entrepreneurs, crowdfunding offers a way to reach large numbers of prospective investors, rather than taking on a traditional business loan. In addition, crowdfunding can also be used for personal projects and social causes.

When focusing on but the business-related types of crowdfunding, including equity crowdfunding, you might be wondering ‘what types are there?’. What does crowdfunding involve, and how can creators and businesses implement a successful effective campaign?

This guide takes you through everything you need to know about this relatively new form of raising money.

componentInstanceProperties.name: description_1
componentInstanceProperties.value: Crowdfunding campaigns pool small amounts from hundreds (or more) of investors, in contrast to large amounts from one or two sources. However, this means that crowdfunding can raise large amounts due to having multiple investors, with some deals drawing millions of dollars in capital raised through equity crowdfunding.

componentInstanceProperties.name: description_2
componentInstanceProperties.value: Crowdfunding can make it much easier and quicker to find investors, whereas the traditional approach requires more time, effort, and resources to persuade investors and secure capital. Not only is crowdfunding changing how entrepreneurs raise their money, it’s brought about more opportunities for investors.

componentInstanceProperties.name: description_3
componentInstanceProperties.value: Crowdfunding campaigns are completely transparent about the business idea, whereas traditional fundraising is characterised by secrecy and confidentiality about the proposed venture.

componentInstanceProperties.name: description_4
componentInstanceProperties.value: A crowdfunding effort promoted over the internet can rapidly reach millions of potential investors with one website, and crowdfunders can obtain feedback about their idea from the general public. In the traditional-fundraising model, only the investors are informed about the idea and there’s no feedback from the general public.

componentInstanceProperties.name: description_5
componentInstanceProperties.value: The traditional model typically gives investors some control over the business. In crowdfunding, the entrepreneur or socialpreneur maintains control, as the investors contribute small sums and have no decision-making powers.

componentInstanceProperties.name: description_6
componentInstanceProperties.value: Crowdfunding campaigns are often focused on innovative and novel business and nonprofit ideas, which can foster more dynamic business sectors and creative community projects. In traditional fundraising, the focus is on profit generation and returns for the investors or donors.

componentInstanceProperties.name: IntroText
componentInstanceProperties.value:
The crowdfunding model features three parties. First, you have the project creator who proposes the idea; and, second, investors who support the idea. Third, you have a facilitating party, and this is usually a crowdfunding platform – such as VentureCrowd – acting as a middle person to bring the parties together.

Crowdfunding platforms play an important role because they make it much easier to raise capital from large pools, and allow entrepreneurs to access more interested investors whose contributions help grow the business. These platforms allow financial pledges to be made and collected. They can offer more security and certainty in this way, for both investors and their payment details and entrepreneurs, respectively. They also provide promotional services that empower project creators with a broader reach.

Crowdfunding platforms can offer more specialised, niche services in addition with the common, core offerings. For example, at VentureCrowd, we’re a multi-asset class crowdfunding platform that provides investors with direct access to handpicked investment opportunities in alternative assets that have traditionally been linked to specialised lenders or institutional investors. Whether you are an established business owner, an entrepreneur or a property developer, we provide alternative finance from a pool of investors across Australia.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
How Crowdfunding

works?

Crowdfunding can seem complicated, but in essence it’s a straightforward concept. How you interact with a crowdfunding platform will depend on which side of the coin you land on - as an investor, or as a business.

Investors greatly benefit from a crowdfunding approach – barriers to investing are minimised, and they may now have access to new and innovative start-ups with potential for high returns. The traditional barriers relating to having a high-net worth to access certain investment opportunities no longer apply.

As an investor, you can easily diversify your portfolio. You might be provided with a percentage of the start-up’s equity (though typically with no management control over the venture), or – in the case of property – can provide monthly returns, and in time, this could end up generating a generous return for you.

The process

For an investor using a crowdfunding platform, the process involved is dependent on which type of investment you choose to pursue. If you’re interested in finding out which type best suits your situation, you can book a call with one of our Customer Relationship Coordinators here.

componentInstanceProperties.name: descriptionList
componentInstanceProperties.value: Unlisted companies usually have a few options when it comes to raising capital, but bank loans, angel investors, venture capital, and private equity might not be available to these businesses. In equity crowdfunding, a start-up or other business raises money from a large pool of investors, and the investors receive a percentage ownership (equity) in the company in exchange for their money. The percentage depends on the amount they invest and the project creator’s proposal. Equity crowdfunding gives investors an excellent opportunity to make real investments in private companies - without the higher risk associated with buying a major stake. For example, VentureCrowd is an equity crowdfunding platform, so rather than receiving a product or simply making a donation, if you invest in one of our deals you will receive equity or ownership in the company that is raising the capital or in the underlying property development asset.--tabSplit--Peer-to-peer lending, also known as debt crowdfunding, allows investors to provide loans to entrepreneurs outside traditional banking channels. Through a peer-to-peer lending platform, businesses will borrow from investors who lend them the funds on the basis the entrepreneur or company will repay them at a later date. For example, an investor or ‘donor’ lends the money and receives a promise, with a date and amount, of repayment from the company. In addition to the principal amount, the investor earns interest.--tabSplit--Donation-based crowdfunding is typically used by nonprofit causes who accept obligation-free donations. Contributors or ’investors’ don’t expect to receive anything in return except for the satisfaction of supporting a cause they believe in. For example, someone in financial difficulty might ask for donations to cover their healthcare or debt repayments, for example. Community projects like a local community garden or new park might also be financed through this type of crowdfunding.--tabSplit--Reward-based crowdfunding is one of the more popular and accessible types of crowdfunding. With this model, investors can pledge money to business ideas, creative projects, new technologies, and other products or services in exchange for a reward. This could be the finished product, a copy of the complete artwork or music album, or tickets to the event the creator is raising money to run. Tiered rewards, with bigger donations attracting bigger rewards, is often a feature of these crowdfunding efforts.--tabSplit--Real estate crowdfunding allows investors to invest small amounts in exchange for equity in real estate. This may be industrial, commercial, or residential real estate. The benefit of this type of crowdfunding is investors can access potentially high returns without the large outlays and complexity involved with a typical real estate purchase. For example, you might invest $5,000 with thousands of other investors to buy an apartment block together. You’ll then receive a periodic return based on the rental income generated. VentureCrowd offers property and real estate crowdfunding opportunities – for more information contact us here.--tabSplit--Human capital crowdfunding is where someone raises money to invest in their own personal growth or personal projects. In return, investors may receive a share of the winnings. One common example is where a poker player invites supporters to donate to support his/her poker playing. In return, the investors are given a share of poker tournament winnings.

componentInstanceProperties.name: headingList
componentInstanceProperties.value: Equity Crowdfunding,Peer-to-peer lending (debt-based),Donation-based crowdfunding,Reward-based crowdfunding,Real estate crowdfunding,Human capital crowdfunding

componentInstanceProperties.name: masterDescription
componentInstanceProperties.value: If you’re considering crowdfunding to begin or expand your investment portfolio, you have a few different types of campaigns to choose from. These differ mainly in the way you as an investor are compensated for your investment outlay.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value: Is crowdfunding worth it?

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Crowdfunding can offer numerous advantages for investors. The major advantages of crowdfunding include the opportunity to choose specific investment opportunities. These could be environmental causes they care about

Overall, crowdfunding efforts could mean more revenue for both businesses and investors as the funds go toward better-tested, novel start-up ideas. It may also mean far lower risk for investors, who invest smaller amounts in innovative projects with potentially high yield investments that can help diversify an investor’s portfolio.

Of course, investing in early stage companies involves risk, and most investors in this asset class try to diversify their allocation across many companies or property developments in order to mitigate or reduce risk. You should consider your personal and financial goals before investing.

Unlike investment options like shares, crowdfunding projects aren’t part of the financial market. As such, investors could be protected against the peaks and troughs of the economic cycle and the volatility of stock markets.

Best of all, it’s easy for investors to invest in crowdfunding campaigns thanks to direct processes through online platforms. They can invest in multiple campaigns, and this supports diversification, enabling them to access more investment opportunities, which could be both novel and high growth. In addition, crowdfunding enables everyday people to become co-owners of companies they believe in, backing causes they stand for and shaping the future of that business in the process.

componentInstanceProperties.name: IntroText
componentInstanceProperties.value:
As with any endeavour, crowdfunding comes with certain challenges to be aware of. However, with the right amount of work and effort, a successful crowdfunding campaign is possible for investors looking for great returns from new, innovative businesses.

Keep these insights in mind, plan ahead, and you’ll likely be able to overcome these challenges.

Effort and education - It’s easy to underestimate the effort that goes into researching and educating yourself as an investor on the potential businesses you would be investing in. Ensuring you complete your due diligence on the business and the platform you are investing with will assist with your investment risk mitigation, and will give greater peace of mind regarding your investment.

Rewards and fulfillment - If your crowdfunding investment is rewards-based, ensuring that the tiers and overall program align with your investment goals and what you hope to get out of the interaction is essential.

Risk - Investors could potentially lose their entire investment, but this isn’t unique to crowdfunding. Similarly, successful businesses can take years to generate returns. The same level of vetting and due diligence as for other investment options can help investors find viable investment opportunities. Additionally, investing through reputable crowdfunding platforms like VentureCrowd, which has a process for screening businesses and entrepreneurs, could reduce the potential risk.

componentInstanceProperties.name: titleText
componentInstanceProperties.value: The challenges of crowdfunding for investors

componentInstanceProperties.name: descriptionList
componentInstanceProperties.value: Are they going it alone? Ask the business if they have a plan of how to tap into their existing networks, how they plan to attract other investors, etc.,, Every business looking to crowdfund their startup or expansion should have invested or at least have a plan to invest in quality marketing materials. These could be videos, digital brochures, landing pages, and infographics.,, Does the business garner the attention of their visitors and other investors by telling a compelling story about their project, product, or service? It might be a pain point they are trying to solve, with the solution the business offers illustrated in response.,, Has the business identified who their key demographic for their service/product is? Does this align with your knowledge of that industry? Consider the target audience in everything you review from the business.,, As an investor you should always speak up and ask the business any questions you may have. It can be very helpful when the business provides a Q&A page on their crowdfunding page and website before they launch. Transparency upfront is an important aspect you should consider when choosing a new crowdfunding investment opportunity.,, Are the business communicative about the above? Do they provide information quickly and comprehensively? As noted above, transparency is important for successful future investments.,, Learning from the experience of others can save you from making the same mistakes and give you insights into their success. Research failures and successes in similar crowdfunding efforts and work out what they did right, and use these learnings in your own investment portfolio.,,By choosing a business that you believe in – whether that be the product or service they offer, the company’s ethos or mission, or for any other reason that sparks your engagement – you will be invested both financially and personally in that business. This will help to give you greater satisfaction in your investment portfolio.

componentInstanceProperties.name: headingList
componentInstanceProperties.value: An existing network, Marketing materials, Tell a story, Demographics, Questions and answers, Communication, Learn from others, Choose a business you believe in

componentInstanceProperties.name: masterDescription
componentInstanceProperties.value: A successful, effective crowdfunding investment campaign doesn’t come about by accident. When considering a crowdfunding venture for success, consider if the business has the following in place:

componentInstanceProperties.name: masterHeading
componentInstanceProperties.value: Tips on becoming a successful crowdfunding investor

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
The most successful

crowdfunding campaigns

With over $170,000,000 raised across 100 deals from wholesale investors, VentureCrowd has been successfully raising venture capital for many years.

With our commitment to highly vetted investments and providing our over 63,000 members with impactful opportunities across venture capital, alternative credit, and property, it’s no surprise our history is filled with successful crowdfunding campaigns

Here are a few examples of our successful campaigns:

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
4DMedcial

4DMedical is a global medical company focusing on changing outcomes for lung-disease patients by revolutionizing respiratory imaging and ventilation analysis. Through VentureCrowd, 4DMedical successfully attracted the investors it sought, and investors were able to invest during early funding to purchase shares at $0.37.

Just 18 months after raising capital through VentureCrowd, 4DMedical grew rapidly and listed on the ASX at $1.50 per share. This gave investors a return of 297%. Today 4DMedical continues to deliver unique and non-invasive imaging technologies that enable unprecedented insight into pulmonary functioning.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Jayride

Jayride is an online marketplace that allows travellers to compare shared airport shuttle and private transfer companies. Through VentureCrowd, Jayride successfully raised $200K in Series A in December 2015, then more than $460K in follow-on rounds in November 2016 and June 2017.

Jayride expanded rapidly and by January 2018, it was listed on the ASX, at an issue price that was more than double the Series A investment. This delivered a gross return of 107% to VentureCrowd investors who participated in the ﬁrst round.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Nexba

Nexba is a FoodTech business that has developed a patent-pending naturally sugar-free sweetener formula. Nexba successfully raised $6M in Series A round through VentureCrowd, followed by two additional rounds of capital. By the end of the 2021 financial year, the company had grown to $35M gross revenue. It is forecast to nearly double again in the 2022 financial year. Nexba has already expanded in the UK and is set for further global growth, and its formula has removed over 3 billion grams of sugar from consumers’ diets to date.

componentInstanceProperties.name: IntroText
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Crowdfunding, enabled by the internet, has transformed the way investors can manage and expand their investment portfolio. Investors can now connect directly with entrepreneurs and creators through platforms such as VentureCrowd, and mitigate their investment risk at the same time.

Sites like VentureCrowd have also allowed investors to contribute small amounts of money in projects or businesses they believe in.

However, investing in a successful crowdfunding campaign requires careful planning and strategising, along with research. Finding an opportunity with a strong business plan, brand identity, and marketing game plan are vital. Studying the strategies of past success stories can provide important learning opportunities you can then apply to your portfolio. And, of course, choosing the right platform for your idea is also essential for giving your campaign the best foundation for a great launch and reaching your goal.

The VentureCrowd platform makes it easy to work collaboratively with our team to find the right investment opportunity for your funds. If you are wondering how to set up a crowdfunding account, with our automated self-service platform, setting up a crowdfunding account for high return investment opportunities is very straightforward. Simply register online via our website, and if you have any questions as you go, you can get in contact with us and we’d love to help you.

componentInstanceProperties.name: titleText
componentInstanceProperties.value: Explore crowdfunding investment opportunities with VentureCrowd

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Crowdfunding with VentureCrowd


Crowdfunding, enabled by the internet, has transformed the way businesses, creators, and social entrepreneurs can access capital to finance their endeavours. Entrepreneurs and creators can connect with numerous investors or donors through crowdfunding platforms rather than trying to access traditional sources of capital like banks and venture capital firms, which tend to be more difficult.

For businesses and project creators, the crowdfunding process offers significant advantages like concept testing and validation, feedback, and generating interest and awareness.

However, implementing a successful crowdfunding campaign requires careful planning and strategising. Having a strong business plan, brand identity, and marketing game plan are vital. Studying the strategies of past success stories can provide important learning opportunities you can then apply to your campaign. Choosing the right platform for your idea is also essential for giving your campaign the best foundation for a great launch and reaching your goal.

The VentureCrowd platform makes it easy to work collaboratively with our team to launch your campaign. If you are wondering how to set up a crowdfunding account, with our automated self-service platform, setting up a crowdfunding account is very straightforward. If you are a new startup looking to raise capital or an established business looking to expand, you can register online via our website. And if you have any questions as you go, you can get in contact with us and we’d love to help you.
